intro: Pouteria luzoniensis var. papuana, commonly known as the Papuan soursop, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to parts of Indonesia and Papua New Guinea. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and produces large, fragrant, yellowish-green fruits with a spiky exterior. The fruit contains a soft, white, edible pulp with numerous black seeds. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of food.
